author: Richard Barley
title: In Global Selloff, It’s All About America
text:
Is there anywhere investors can hide from the global stock selloff? Perhaps not, when its roots lie in the U.S. Stock markets elsewhere might look more attractively priced, but it will require stabilization stateside to allow investors to take advantage.
Even as there has been a focus on global growth driving up broad measures like the MSCI All-Country World index this year, it has been moves in U.S. assets—first swings in the dollar, then rapidly rising Treasury yields and now sharply declining U.S. stocks—that have really...
